qas.question: When was the wedding of Rolfe and Pocahontas?
What did English laws not exclude people with some native blood from being?
Who married Indigenous women early on?
Who was an ancestor of the First Families of Virginia?
Who did some early female settlers marry?
What was later contact between Indigenous Americans and Europeans like?
Where did no marriages take place between European men and Native women?
When was John Rolfe divorced from Pocahontas?
Who was an ancestor to many First Families of North Carolina?

context: Some early <a2_0>male settlers<a2_0/> married <b5_0>Indigenous American women<b5_0/> and had informal unions with them. Early contact between Indigenous Americans and Europeans was often <b6_0>charged with tension<b6_0/>, but also had moments of friendship, cooperation, and intimacy. Marriages took place in both <b7_0>English and Latin colonies<b7_0/> between European men and Native women. For instance, on <a0_0><b8_0>April 5, 1614<b8_0/><a0_0/>, Pocahontas, a Powhatan woman in <a3_0>present-day Virginia<a3_0/>, married the Englishman John Rolfe of Jamestown. Their son <a4_0><b9_0>Thomas Rolfe<b9_0/><a4_0/> was an ancestor to many descendants in First Families of Virginia. As a result, English laws did not exclude people with some Indigenous American ancestry from being <a1_0>considered English or white<a1_0/>.
